syllabus:
**Course description:**

    Thiscourse aims to familiarize the students enrolled with the fundamental conceptsof language and linguistics as well as the basic skills required for doinglinguistic analysis. It is hoped that with these concepts and skills thestudents will be better equipped both for more advanced linguistics courses andas competent language teachers/learners.

**(\*Prerequisite: Introduction to Linguistics I)**
===================================================

**Textbook:**

_An Introductionto Language_ (10th edition concise version, 11th edition), by Victoria Fromkin, Robert Rodman & Nina Hyams

**Requirements and Evaluation**:

Quizzes(and assignments)  30%

Exams   60%    

Attendance& Participation  10%

**Bonus points(at most 5 points):**

1.  Participate in a 2-hour workshop or conference, take notes, and **hand-write** a 200-word report to express your own opinions to get one bonus point. If the workshop/conference is 4 hours long, you should write a 400-word report to get 2 bonus points.
2.  Participate in a 2-hour talk or listen to an on-line talk on linguistics, take notes, and **hand-write** a 200-word report to express your own opinions to get one bonus point. 

**Other Requirements:**

1.  All the assignments must be handed in on time. Late submission is not acceptable.
2.  Attendance is required. If you can’t come to a class, you must email me asap; otherwise, it will **cost you two points from your final grade**. If you are absent in case of uncontrollable situations (e.g., illness, etc.), be sure to give me the valid proof within two weeks.
3.  Make-up quizzes are allowed only during the class break on that day and you can only get 70% of the scores you get in the make-up quizzes. **NO make-up exams are possible** unless you are hospitalized/quarantined or permitted in advance. You can only get 70% of the scores you get in the make-up exams unless you are hospitalized/quarantined or attend important contests for the university on the day of the exam.
4.  **NO SNACK** is allowed in class. Noise from cellular phones is not allowed.
5.  Grades are **NOT** negotiable.
6.  **You must  wear a mask to class.**
